title: Issue Create Fields Enhancement
description:
Enhance sl issue create and sl issue update commands to support structured fields (--acceptance-criteria, --dod, --design, --notes) that already exist in the JSONL model. Update the specledger.tasks and specledger.implement prompts to utilize these fields for better task generation and implementation tracking. Improve task blocking relationship logic for proper dependency trees.

Key deliverables:
- CLI flags for create: --acceptance-criteria, --dod, --design, --notes
- CLI flags for update: --dod, --check-dod, --uncheck-dod
- Updated issue show display with dedicated sections
- Updated tasks.md and implement.md prompt templates
- Improved blocking relationship instructions

title: US6: Parent-Child Relationships for Task Hierarchy
description:
As a developer using SpecLedger, I want to set parent-child relationships between issues so that I can organize tasks into hierarchies (epic → feature → task) and query child issues efficiently.

Goal: Add --parent flag with single parent constraint and cycle detection.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Users can set parent on issue create and update
- Single parent constraint enforced
- Self-parent prevention
- Circular relationship detection
- Tree view displays children correctly

WHY: The Issue model needs a ParentID field to support parent-child relationships for task hierarchies.

DESIGN: File: pkg/issues/issue.go
- Add ParentID *string field to Issue struct with json tag "parentId,omitempty"
- Add ParentID *string field to IssueUpdate struct
- No default value (nil means no parent)

ACCEPTANCE: Issue struct has ParentID field that can be set and persisted to JSONL.

[ ] go build succeeds

title: Implement parent validation (single, self, cycle)
description:
WHY: Parent-child relationships need validation to prevent invalid hierarchies.

DESIGN: Files: pkg/issues/validation.go (new), pkg/cli/commands/issue.go
Validation rules:
1. Single parent: Return error if issue already has parent and trying to set new one
2. Self-parent: Return error if parentID == issueID
3. Cycle detection: Traverse parent chain to detect cycles
4. Parent existence: Verify parent issue exists

Error messages:
- "issue already has a parent, remove existing parent first"
- "cannot set self as parent"
- "circular parent-child relationship detected"
- "parent issue not found: <id>"

ACCEPTANCE: All validation rules enforced with correct error messages.

DEFINITION OF DONE:
[ ] Single parent constraint enforced
[ ] Self-parent prevention enforced
[ ] Cycle detection implemented
[ ] Parent existence check implemented
[ ] All error messages match spec
